intro: Karkandela × malabarica, commonly known as the hybrid karkandela, is a rare and ornamental plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Karkandela cuneata and Karkandela malabarica, characterized by its unique foliage and floral traits. The plant typically exhibits broad, ovate leaves with a glossy texture and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its rarity and horticultural value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
